attachments.title: Is opening up your source code worth it? Terry Cavanagh thinks it was for VVVVVV
attachments.text: A lot of game developer still worry about being more open with their code but it seems Terry Cavanagh (VVVVVV, Super Hexagon, Dicey Dungeons) believes it was worth it.
attachments.fallback: GamingOnLinux: Is opening up your source code worth it? Terry Cavanagh thinks it was for VVVVVV

messages.text:
Hello :wave:
Is anyone using Google Cloud's Pub/Sub from Julia?

elements.text: Is anyone using Google Cloud's Pub/Sub from Julia?

messages.text:
Hey! We (<http://leuko.com|leuko.com>) are in search of mocking libraries to help us write tests. We haven't found anything that fully meets our needs yet. What we're looking for is
- Flexible interaction-based testing
- Flexible verification, argument matchers
- Extensible argument matching framework

Does anything public exist that covers this, beyond SimpleMock.jl and Mocking.jl?
SimpleMock.jl and Mocking.jl fall short for us because either they 1) don't have all of the features above, 2) require editing the source code, 3) are slow (Cassette.jl), 4) don't work with Julia 1.6, or some combination of those.
Otherwise, are there other people that need such tooling? Perhaps it could be a collaborative effort?
